content: Great problem but caught me off guard in game when I realised that the question mark can be on the right side of the underscore too, didn't notice the fact that it is mentioned in the examples. Perhaps a message warning the user to take note of that would be an improvement or is it just me?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I already have an idea on how to solve it just by reading it and seeing the examples

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: l'énoncé est claire.
les jeux de tests sont bine définis et recouvre tous les cas

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A hesitant approval... I got it in just under 5 minutes, but that was without the stress of being in an actual challenge.

Pro: I like the complexity, the different solutions needed for the different parts. Also, with the examples in the goal section it is clear that all situations can occur, so the complexity does not arrive as a surprise.
Con: the complexity might be just too much for a clash for some (I, for one, would stress out doing this one 'Fastest'. 'Shortest' on the other hand would be very interesting, because it needs multiple steps and therefore multiple aspects to making it short).

Nonetheless, approved, because I liked it and it is doable.

I very much like this puzzle but it may take too long with the ? occurring in any of the three parts of the string.  Each case must be handled differently.  Additionally, because you only provide a single example with the ? in the alphanumeric character section, it may be a surprise that the ? can occur in the place of the demarcator (the "_") or the parity value portion.  The strong assumption is that the ? occurs in the first part.  This makes sense as the presumption is that we must derive the whole passphrase (alphanumeric, demarcator and parity value)  by using the parity value to calculate the missing character in the alphanumeric portion.  

I suggest either limiting the missing character to the alphanumeric portion or providing more examples so that the solver doesn't have the wrong impression going into the problem and thereby lose a lot of time.

You may format ? and _ as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks around them.

Also please change "chars" to "characters".

Thanks.
thanks for your feedback, I've made the suggested modifications

Thanks, I've modified accordingly:
- added 3 examples to cover the 3 cases
- also modified the test names that covers the 3 cases
